General information.Content: This database contains data from international key comparisons for radionuclide metrology since the inception of the international system of reference (SIR) for radionuclide metrology at the BIPM in 1976.
General information.Note: This version of the machine-readable comparison report is not definitive. The format is under discussion within the CCRI and CIPM to best reflect the requirements of ionizing radiation metrology and to conform to the SI digital framework. Users can use this document to analyse key comparison data and metadata more efficiently with their software. However, users should bear in mind that the format will necessarily evolve in subsequent updates of this key comparison, which will not guarantee the long-term compatibility of their interface.

References.[1]: Romain Coulon et al 2022 Meas. Sci. Technol. 33 024003 - https://doi.org/10.1088/1361-6501/ac3fc4
References.[2]: Romain Coulon et al 2023 Meas. Sci. Technol. 34 074009 - https://doi.org/10.1088/1361-6501/accd0b

Key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Tl-201(200.Reference of the published comparison re: Ratel G., Michotte C., BIPM comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Tl-201 of activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{201}$Tl, \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/41/1A/06015}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2004, \textbf{41}, Tech. Suppl., 06015}

Ratel G., Michotte C., Moune M., Bobin C., Kossert K., Johansson L., Activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{201}$Tl for the LNE-LNHB, France, PTB, Germany and the NPL, UK in the ongoing comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Tl-201, \href{http://www.iopscience.iop.org/0026-1394/45/1A/06008/}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2008, \textbf{45}, Tech. Suppl., 06008}

Key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Tl-201(202.Reference of the published comparison re: Michotte C., Courte S., Nonis M., Coulon R., Judge S., Ratel G., Fitzgerald R. and Pibida L., Update of the BIPM comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1.Tl-201 of activity measurements of the radionuclide $^{201}$Tl to include the 2011 result of the NIST (United States), \href{https://doi.org/10.1088/0026-1394/59/1A/06008}{\textit{Metrologia}, 2022, \textbf{59}, Tech. Suppl., 06008}

Laboratory.Full name: Australian Nuclear Science and Technology Organisation
Laboratory.Address: New Illawarra Road, Lucas Heights 2234 NSW

Data from ANSTO-1994.Comment(s) on the measurement method(s): Calibrated by interpolation from the standardization of other radionuclides at ANSTO
Data from ANSTO-1994.Comments on the SIR measurement: due to a long delay between measurement in the SIR and the reference date,  combined with the uncertainty on the impurity as given by the laboratory
Data from ANSTO-1994.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1

Laboratory.Full name: Government Office of the Capital City Budapest

Data from BKFH-1997.Reference for the decay data used by the: Schrader H., 1989 Measurement of the half lives of $^{18}$F, $^{56}$Co, $^{125}$I, $^{195}$Au and $^{201}$Tl International Journal of Applied Radiation and Isotopes 40 381-383
Data from BKFH-1997.Comments on impurities contained into th: gamma spectrometry measurements at the BIPM gives 0.801(12)~\% for $^{202}$Tl (see \cite{KCRV_2004} for discussion).
Data from BKFH-1997.Comments on the SIR measurement: reflects uncertainty on the impurity as given by the laboratory
Data from BKFH-1997.Status of the data: Published with the key comparison BIPM.RI(II)-K1
